intro: Rhodax alpestris, commonly known as the alpine rhodax, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pink flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine meadows and mountainous areas. It has a low-growing habit with woody stems and oval-shaped leaves. Rhodax alpestris is adapted to cold climates and is often found in regions with harsh environmental conditions.
